oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Minnie Pearl Comedy Routines - Disc 15, 16, 17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of a variety of clips featuring Minnie Pearl's comedy routines. The various stand up recordings feature Red Foley (musician), Rod Brasfield (comedian), George Morgan (musician), and Helen Traubel (opera singer). The recordings are labeled disc number fifteen, sixteen and seventeen. The recordings are believed to take place at the Grand Ole Opry. The recordings are from a number of unidentified dates.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Red Foley; Rod Brasfield; George Morgan; Helen Traubel
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (00:03) Minnie Pearl reveals she received a post card from her aunt Abigale -- (00:43) Red Foley reads question and answer letters to Pearl; additionally, Pearl expresses her distain to increasing age -- (02:56) Pearl reflects on Brother, Uncle Naybob and the local undertaker -- (04:17) Pearl reveals that Brother wrecked his truck by driving down the middle of the road -- (04:44) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (04:45) Pearl reveals she was kissed by a man with a bushy mustache, and Red Foley expresses his disbelief in Pearl getting kissed -- (06:53) Pearl revealed uncle Naybob played a jug in a band -- (07:38) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (07:46) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (07:51) Pearl reveals that April is the month of April fools -- (09:24) Pearl reveals Herman the hermit can speak to animals -- (10:00) Pearl asks about Rod Brasfield's uncle who strained a muscle -- (10:43) Pearl reveals that uncle Naybob will be encouraged to knit when his wife is away -- (11:27) Pearl discusses how Mr. Pudrey's daughter's weren't his biggest problem -- (12:05) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (12:17) George Morgan and Helen Traubel introduce Pearl -- (12:49) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified]) -- (12:56) Pearl and Traubel discuss the proper way to introduce oneself -- (13:37) Pearl asks Traubel to judge her operatic skills; additionally, both Traubel and Pearl attempt operatic notes -- (15:19) Traubel asks is Pearl ever had a music couch -- (15:50) Brasfield introduces himself, and Traubel reveals Brasfield was discussing his career in opera -- (16:43) Pearl reveals her wide background -- (16:54) Unidentified fiddle riff ([Unidentified])
